intro: Cacalia araripensis, commonly known as the Araripé bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and features showy, violet-blue flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cacalia araripensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
